description: Easy - Rome's Consolidation and Final Outcomes

questions.question: What was the primary reason Rome defeated Macedonia so decisively at Cynoscephalae?
options: Roman soldiers possessed superior physical attributes including greater height and strength throughout their ranks
The Roman legionary system was more flexible and adaptable to terrain
Romans maintained overwhelming superiority in total troop numbers and possessed significantly better quality weapons overall
Macedonian soldiers demonstrated a complete lack of courage and refused to engage in direct combat
questions.text_reference: Section 3 - The Battle of Cynoscephalae: The Tactical Contest

questions.question: How long was the siege of Carthage during the Third Punic War?
options: One year
Less than two years
Approximately three years
More than five years

questions.question: What did Rome do to Carthage after conquering it?
options: Incorporated it as a new province and rebuilt the city
Allowed local leaders to continue governing under Roman supervision
Systematically destroyed it and enslaved the population
Left it abandoned but intact for future settlement
questions.text_reference: Section 8 - The Fall and Destruction of Carthage

questions.question: What new Roman province was created from Carthage's territory?
options: Africa
Libya
Numidia
Mauretania

questions.question: Which empire remained nominally independent but increasingly dependent on Rome by 150 BCE?
options: Macedonia
The Seleucid Empire
Egypt
Greece

questions.question: What advantage did the First Macedonian War give to Rome?
options: Complete defeat of Macedonia
Control of Greece immediately
Demonstrated Rome's capacity for simultaneous warfare
Established Rome as the dominant Mediterranean power

questions.question: Which of these statements about Egypt is correct?
options: Egypt defeated Rome in military conflict
Egypt successfully maintained complete independence from Rome
Egypt became increasingly dependent on Rome for security
Egypt allied with Carthage against Rome

questions.question: Why might Rome have encouraged Masinissa's harassment of Carthage?
options: To weaken Carthage and justify later military action
To help Carthage recover from the Second War
To test Carthage's military strength
To prevent Carthage from attacking Rome directly

questions.question: What was the significance of the Battle of Pydna (168 BCE)?
options: Rome defeated the Seleucids
Rome definitively broke Macedonian power
Carthage made its final stand against Rome
Greeks defeated Roman forces

questions.question: Which of these consequences followed Rome's defeat of all major rivals by 149 BCE? (SELECT ALL THAT APPLY)
options: Rome became a dominant Mediterranean power but only in the Western part of it
Rome immediately collapsed due to overexpansion
Rome became the unchallenged Mediterranean superpower
Wealth from conquered territories reshaped Roman society
Competition for control of provinces created internal conflicts
questions.text_reference: Section 10 - The Overall Picture: Rome Unchallenged
